com.radaee.util

Class RadaeePDFManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.radaee.util.RadaeePDFManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    RadaeePluginCallback.PDFReaderListener

    public class RadaeePDFManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements RadaeePluginCallback.PDFReaderListener
    A class that can be used by depending modules, to facilitate the PDF Viewer usage.

    • Method Detail

      • activateLicense

        public boolean activateLicense(android.content.Context context,
                               int licenseType,
                               java.lang.String companyName,
                               java.lang.String mail,
                               java.lang.String key)
        Activates the SDK license. Should be called before show, open methods
        Parameters:
        context - Context object must be derived from CoontextWrapper
        licenseType - 0: standard license, 1: professional license, 2: premium license.
        companyName - company name (not package name)
        mail - mail
        key - the license activation key
        Returns:
        true if the license was activated correctly, false otherwise

      • show

        public void show(android.content.Context context,
                 java.lang.String url,
                 java.lang.String password)
        Opens the passed file and shows the PDF reader.
        Parameters:
        context - the current context.
        url - the url can be remote (starts with http/https), or local
        password - the pdf's password, if no apssword, pass empty string

      • show

        public void show(android.content.Context context,
                 java.lang.String url,
                 java.lang.String password,
                 boolean readOnlyMode,
                 boolean automaticSave,
                 int gotoPage,
                 java.lang.String bmpFormat,
                 java.lang.String author)
        Opens the passed file and shows the PDF reader.
        Parameters:
        context - the current context.
        url - the url can be remote (starts with http/https), or local
        password - the pdf's password, if no apssword, pass empty string
        readOnlyMode - if true, the document will be opened in read-only mode
        automaticSave - if true, the modifications will be saved automatically, else a requester to save will be shown
        gotoPage - if greater than 0, the reader will render directly the passed page (0-index: from 0 to Document.GetPageCount - 1)
        bmpFormat - bmp format, can be RGB_565 or ARGB_4444, default is ALPHA_8
        author - if not empty, it will be used to set annotations' author during creation.

      • openFromAssets

        public void openFromAssets(android.content.Context context,
                           java.lang.String path,
                           java.lang.String password)
        Opens the passed assets file and shows the PDF reader.
        Parameters:
        context - the current context.
        path - the asset name/path
        password - the pdf's password, if no apssword, pass empty string

        public void openFromAssets(android.content.Context context,
                           java.lang.String path,
                           java.lang.String password,
                           java.lang.String bmpFormat)
        Opens the passed assets file and shows the PDF reader.
        Parameters:
        context - the current context.
        path - the asset name/path
        password - the pdf's password, if no apssword, pass empty string
        bmpFormat - bmp format, can be RGB_565 or ARGB_4444, default is ALPHA_8

      • setFirstPageCover

        public void setFirstPageCover(boolean firstPageCover)
        Sets if the first page should be rendered as cover or dual Should be called before show, open methods
        Parameters:
        firstPageCover - if true the first page will be single, if false it will be dual (same as view_mode = 4)

        Returns:

        Parameters:
        json - object of the document form fields dictionary

        Returns document's pages count
        Returns:

      • extractTextFromPage

        public java.lang.String extractTextFromPage(int page)
        extract the text content of the given page
        Parameters:
        page - the page number, 0-index (from 0 to Document.GetPageCount - 1)
        Returns:
        the given page's text

      • encryptDocAs

        public java.lang.String encryptDocAs(java.lang.String dst,
                                     java.lang.String upswd,
                                     java.lang.String opswd,
                                     int perm,
                                     int method,
                                     java.lang.String id)
        encrypt document and save into another file.
        this method require premium license.
        Parameters:
        dst - path to saveï¼Œ same as path parameter of SaveAs.
        upswd - user password, can be null (is the public password (shared with authorized users). It's sufficient to open the file with applied permission mask set).
        opswd - owner password, can be null (is the password that allow opening the file without any restriction from the permission mask).
        perm - permission to set, same as GetPermission() method.
        bit 1-2 reserved
        bit 3(0x4) print
        bit 4(0x8) modify
        bit 5(0x10) extract text or image
        others: see PDF reference
        method - set 3 means using AES 256bits encrypt(Acrobat X), V=5 and R = 6 mode, others AES with V=4 and R=4 mode.
        id - must be 32 bytes for file ID. it is divided to 2 array in native library, as each 16 bytes (something like the encryption seed or salt in some other encryption scheme. That id is a reserved code that make password stronger).
        Returns:
        Success of error.

      • addToBookmarks

        public java.lang.String addToBookmarks(android.content.Context mContext,
                                       java.lang.String filePath,
                                       int page,
                                       java.lang.String bookmarkLabel)
        Adds the given page to the bookmarks.
        Parameters:
        mContext - context object
        filePath - the original pdf file
        page - 0 based page no.
        bookmarkLabel - label of Bookmark (can be empty string)
        Returns:
        a string that indicates the result

      • removeBookmark

        public boolean removeBookmark(int page,
                              java.lang.String filePath)
        Removes the given page from bookmarks.
        Parameters:
        page - 0 based page no.
        filePath - the orignal pdf file
        Returns:
        true or false.

      • getBookmarksAsJson

        public java.lang.String getBookmarksAsJson(java.lang.String filePath)
        returns a list of bookmarked pages in json format
        Parameters:
        filePath - the orignal pdf file
        Returns:
        json string or null ex: [{"Page": 4,"Label": "Page: 5"}, {"Page": 1,"Label": "Page: 2"}]

      • addAnnotAttachment

        public boolean addAnnotAttachment(java.lang.String attachmentPath)
        add a file as an attachment.
        this can be invoked after ObjsStart or Render or RenderToBmp.
        this method require professional or premium license.
        Parameters:
        attachmentPath - absolute path name to the file.
        Returns:
        true or false.

      • renderAnnotToFile

        public java.lang.String renderAnnotToFile(int page,
                                          int annotIndex,
                                          java.lang.String renderPath,
                                          int bitmapWidth,
                                          int bitmapHeight)
        Render annot to a bitmap, and save it to the given path
        Parameters:
        page - the page number, 0-index (from 0 to Document.GetPageCount - 1)
        annotIndex - annotation index
        renderPath - the directory path in which the annotation will be saved (ex:/mnt/sdcard/bitmap.png) (in case of sdcard make sure the WRITE_EXTERNAL_STORAGE permission is granted)
        bitmapWidth - the desired width of the result bitmap, 0 in case of using original width
        bitmapHeight - the desired height of the result bitmap, 0 in case of using original height
